comm.util

Class AngleUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • comm.util.AngleUtility

  • public final class AngleUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class containing various useful methods for dealing with angles.
    Author:
    Andrei Purcarus

        Converts the given angle to the range [0, 360).

      • average

        public static final double average(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Double> anglesInDegrees)
        Computes the proper average of a collection of angles. For example, the average of 45 degrees and 315 degrees is computed as 0 degrees and not 180 degrees. In the case of an indeterminate average, the value returned is the same as that of Math.atan2(0, 0). This can occur, for example, when averaging 0 degrees and 180 degrees. The average is returned in the range [0.0, 360.0).

      • average

        public static final double average(double[] anglesInDegrees)
        Computes the proper average of an array of angles. For example, the average of 45 degrees and 315 degrees is computed as 0 degrees and not 180 degrees. In the case of an indeterminate average, the value returned is the same as that of Math.atan2(0.0, 0.0). This can occur, for example, when averaging 0 degrees and 180 degrees. The average is returned in the range [0.0, 360.0).

      • average

        public static final double average(java.lang.Double[] anglesInDegrees)
        Computes the proper average of an array of angles. For example, the average of 45 degrees and 315 degrees is computed as 0 degrees and not 180 degrees. In the case of an indeterminate average, the value returned is the same as that of Math.atan2(0.0, 0.0). This can occur, for example, when averaging 0 degrees and 180 degrees. The average is returned in the range [0.0, 360.0).

        Computes the minimal absolute difference between the first angle and the second angle.

        Returns the minimal difference between the first angle and the second angle.
